TEXT: The applicants , a family , reside in ORG in GPE . The first applicant is an NORP citizen born in DATE . The second applicant , his wife , is a citizen of the GPE born in DATE . The third and fourth applicants are their daughters , born in DATE and DATE , respectively . The third applicant is an NORP citizen . Before the Commission they are represented by PERSON . PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

The first applicant entered GPE together with his parents in DATE or DATE . In DATE he was sentenced to detention in an educational labour institution ( ORG ) on account of contravening LAW ( Betäubungsmittelgesetz ) . Still in DATE he fled to GPE where he spent DATE undertaking his military service .
In DATE the first applicant returned to GPE whereupon his sentence of DATE was converted to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment suspended on probation .
In DATE the first applicant was sentenced to a fine of MONEY ( CHF ) on account of a drug offence .

The first and second applicant married in DATE . In DATE , their first daughter , the third applicant , was born . The first applicant acquired the authorisation to establish domicile ( Niederlassungsbewilligung ) in GPE , the second and third applicants obtained a residence permission ( GPE ) .

In DATE ORG ( Bezirksgericht ) sentenced the first applicant to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment for having contravened LAW . ORG regarded his culpability ( PERSON ) as severe . Thus , the first applicant , who was himself a drug addict , had obtained QUANTITY of cocain , of which he had used QUANTITY for himself , and sold the remainder . However , the punishment was suspended in favour of stationary therapy . The first applicant has since been working in a pizzeria . According to a progress report of DATE , his expulsion would endanger his integration into social and professional life .

As a result of the first applicant ’s criminal conviction , ORG ) withdrew on DATE his right to establish domicile in GPE and ordered his expulsion . His appeal was dismissed by ORG for ORG , ORG on DATE , his further appeal by ORG ( Verwaltungsgericht ) on CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the fourth applicant was born . She has kidney problems and must regularly take antibiotic medication .

The first , second and third applicant filed an administrative law appeal which ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed on DATE . The ORG relied in particular on LAW ( a ) of ORG über PERSON ) according to which a foreigner may be expelled from GPE if he or she has been convicted by a court of a criminal offence . The ORG then considered , also in the light of LAW , the proportionality of expelling the first applicant .

ORG considered , on the one hand , that the first applicant had repeatedly been convicted , and that ORG had regarded his culpability as severe . It nevertheless noted that , after his criminal conviction he was afforded therapeutic treatment in the context of which he had found employment . According to a therapy report , his expulsion would endanger his integration into social and professional life .

On the other hand , while the first applicant had been living in GPE for DATE , he had spent DATE in GPE where he had undertaken his military service . As a result , life in his home country would bring about certain difficulties , though he could not be considered a foreigner there . He would also benefit from the professional training obtained in GPE . His wife , the second applicant , had only lived for a period of DATE in GPE , and the circumstances in GPE did not substantially differ from those in GPE . Their daughter , the third applicant , was still of an adaptable age . It would not be unreasonable for them to travel to GPE .
